summary:
I’m an Investment Researcher with 30 years of experience in the asset management and pension industry. 
By connecting complex research content to practical and comprehensible client solutions I contribute to higher client satisfaction.
I’m a curious and rational person who can easily communicate with various layers in an organization.  For a good understanding I focus on listening and questioning, thereby creating support  for solutions. I consider reports and presentations the icing on the cake.

profile_positions.title: Portfolio and pension strategist

profile_positions.description:
Advising the Robeco PPI board on all decisions concerning investments. This included amongst others the introduction and maintenance of a default life cycle glide path, introduction of risk profiles, hedging of interest rate risk, construction of an opt out universe, tailor made glide paths, etc.

- Monitoring, analyses and reporting of the key characteristics of the life cycle asset mixes. This included setting up criteria and executing replacements of products in both the fully delegated- and the opt out universe.
- In general: taking care that the relevant insights of Investments get to the board, asked and unasked for, and that the Robeco PPI is represented well within Investments.

profile_positions.description:
Responsibility for the guidelines for constructing portfolios by Rabobank offices. This was a further enhancement of “Breedte-analyse”. The portfolios could consist of stocks, bonds, mutual funds or structured products. The activities included the set up and the maintenance of the risk monitoring system that checks whether a Rabobank client’s portfolio is compliant with the client’s risk profile.
“Investment Analyses” was also responsible for setting up open architecture for Rabobank, including manager selection and the maintenance via Mutual Fund research and recommended portfolios for the various risk profiles.
Worth mentioning is that newly issued (structured) products by either Rabobank or Robeco for distribution at Rabobank offices required approval by “Investment analyses”. Obviously, these products were also analyzed in the secondary market.
	 
Publicatons and presentations
Amongst others the publication and presentation of “De marketing van gestructureerde producten” (“The marketing of structured products”).

profile_positions.description: Due to the so called Doetinchem scandal, Rabobank Netherlands felt the urge to set up and implement a centralised advisory philosophy and framework for the recommendations that local advisors provided their clients. This was the responsibility for the “Breedte analyse” team. Implementation included amongst others the introduction of risk profiles (doelrisicoprofielen).
